unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Elevating Quality Control Practices**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Elevating Quality Control Practices**

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26 – With Diwali around the corner, the pressure is on manufacturers to deliver defect-free products, especially in the bustling electronics and festive goods sectors. Effective quality control is crucial.
normalised: Mumbai, October twenty six – With Diwali around the corner, the pressure is on manufacturers to deliver defect-free products, especially in the bustling electronics and festive goods sectors. Effective quality control is crucial.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT-Delhi are advocating for a shift from reactive to proactive quality management. This involves implementing robust inspection procedures at every stage of the manufacturing process, from raw material sourcing (ensuring suppliers meet stringent standards) to final product testing. Think of it like perfecting a Hyderabadi biryani - each ingredient and cooking step influences the final taste and texture.
normalised: Experts at I I T-Delhi are advocating for a shift from reactive to proactive quality management. This involves implementing robust inspection procedures at every stage of the manufacturing process, from raw material sourcing (ensuring suppliers meet stringent standards) to final product testing. Think of it like perfecting a Hyderabadi biryani - each ingredient and cooking step influences the final taste and texture.

unnormalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) reports that companies investing in advanced QC technologies, such as AI-powered visual inspection systems, have seen a 15-20% reduction in product defects and a significant boost to customer satisfaction. This proactive approach not only minimizes recalls and rework but also enhances brand reputation. Remember, even a small flaw can impact sales, especially during peak festival season where consumers are particularly discerning. Companies in Tamil Nadu are using lean manufacturing principles to streamline processes and minimize waste, further enhancing overall quality and efficiency. A well-oiled manufacturing process is key to success.
